news.title: Retail sales increased 1.4% in March, greater than expected
news.summary: Retail sales were expected to increase 1.2% in March, according to the Dow Jones consensus. Retail sales are a proxy for consumer spending in the U.S.

news.title: JPMorgan Chase sues more customers who allegedly stole cash in 'infinite money glitch'
news.summary: The episode highlights the lengths JPMorgan Chase, the biggest U.S. bank by assets, will go to claw back funds it is owed and to deter future crimes.

news.title: Global trade outlook has 'deteriorated sharply' amid Trump tariff uncertainty, WTO warns
news.summary: The World Trade Organization has warned that the outlook for global trade has "deteriorated sharply" in the wake of President Donald Trump's tariffs regime.

news.title: U.S. vehicle supply is falling amid tariff fear-buying
news.summary: Consumers flock to stores ahead of potential price increases due to tariffs. Supplies of new and used vehicles for sale are declining rapidly in the U.S.

news.title: Homebuyers rush to riskier loans, as tariff turmoil pushes interest rates higher
news.summary: Mortgage rates moved sharply higher last week, causing a drop in mortgage demand and a surge in homebuyers seeking riskier loans.

news.title: It’s already illegal for undocumented immigrants to get Social Security. So why did Trump sign a new memo?
news.summary: President Donald Trump signed a memo on Tuesday barring undocumented immigrants from getting Social Security benefits. It's something they were already not able to access under existing law.

news.title: Higher prices or recession? Only one of these inflation predictors can be right.
news.summary: University of Michigan survey has a better record than the University of Michigan. Here's what it's saying now. The breakeven inflation rate has a good record, but it's not as good as the University's.

news.title: Why this strategist is expecting a lost decade for U.S. stocks, even without a recession
news.summary: The U.S. exceptionalism argument is not going to work for the next five to 10 years, say strategists at BCA Research.

news.title: U.S. retail sales surge to 26-month high as buyers rush to avoid tariff-related price hikes
news.summary: The economy may be in good shape, but trade wars pose a risk. The U.S. has the largest trade deficit in the world, according to the World Bank.

news.title: Three times when it’s OK to take Social Security early
news.summary: Age 62 is the most common age to claim Social Security, according to the Social Security Administration. Age 62 is also the most popular age to apply for disability benefits.
